section.title: Terminology and notation

li.title: similar matrices
li.p: a pair of square matrices A and B for which there exists an invertible matrix P satisfying B=\inv{P}AP

li.title: transition matrix
li.p: an invertible matrix P that realizes a similarity relationship B=\inv{P}AP for similar matrices A and B

li.title: diagonalizable
li.p: a square matrix that is similar to a diagonal matrix

li.title: transition matrix
li.p: an invertible matrix P that realizes a similarity relationship B=\inv{P}AP for similar matrices A and B

note.p: We have already used the term transition matrix to mean a change-of-basis matrix (see ), and we will justify this double definition of the term when we study similarity in more generality in .

li.title: diagonalizable
li.p: a square matrix that is similar to a diagonal matrix
